intro: Elatostema lui, commonly known as the small heartleaf or silverweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Elatostema lui is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and rocky crevices. It is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense mats in its native range.
